get.description:
Returns all records in the audit log, optionally for a certain date range. 
This contains information about events like space exports, group membership 
changes, app installations, etc. For more information, see 
Audit log 
in the Confluence administrator's guide.

parameters.description:
Filters the results to the records on or before the endDate. 
The endDate must be specified as a timestamp.
parameters.name: endDate

parameters.description:
The maximum number of records to return per page. 
Note, this may be restricted by fixed system limits.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description:
Filters the results to records that have string property values 
matching the searchString.
parameters.name: searchString

parameters.description: The starting index of the returned records.
parameters.name: start

parameters.description:
Filters the results to the records on or after the startDate. 
The startDate must be specified as a timestamp.
parameters.name: startDate

200.description: Returned if the requested records are returned.

post.description: Creates a record in the audit log.

associatedObjects.description:
Objects that were associated with the event. For example, if the event 
was a space permission change then the associated object would be the 
space.

author.description:
The user that actioned the event. If author is not specified, then all 
author properties will be set to null/empty, except for type which 
will be set to 'user'.

category.description:
The category of the event, which is displayed in the 'Event type' column 
on the audit log in the Confluence UI.

changedValues.description: The values that were changed in the event.

creationDate.description:
The creation date-time of the audit record, as a timestamp. This is converted 
to a date-time display in the Confluence UI. If the creationDate is not 
specified, then it will be set to the timestamp for the current date-time.

description.description:
A long description of the event, which is displayed in the 'Description' 
field on the audit log in the Confluence UI.

remoteAddress.description: The IP address of the computer where the event was initiated from.

summary.description:
The summary of the event, which is displayed in the 'Change' column on 
the audit log in the Confluence UI.

sysAdmin.description: Indicates whether the event was actioned by a system administrator.

200.description: Returned if the record is created in the audit log.

get.description: Exports audit records as a CSV file or ZIP file.

parameters.description:
Filters the exported results to the records on or before the endDate. 
The endDate must be specified as a timestamp.
parameters.name: endDate

parameters.description: The format of the export file for the audit records.
parameters.name: format

parameters.description:
Filters the exported results to records that have string property values 
matching the searchString.
parameters.name: searchString

parameters.description:
Filters the exported results to the records on or after the startDate. 
The startDate must be specified as a timestamp.
parameters.name: startDate

200.description: Returned if the requested export of the audit records is returned.

get.description:
Returns the retention period for records in the audit log. The retention 
period is how long an audit record is kept for, from creation date until 
it is deleted.

200.description: Returned if the requested retention period is returned.

put.description:
Sets the retention period for records in the audit log. The retention period 
can be set to a maximum of 20 years.

number.description: The number of units for the retention period.

units.description: The unit of time that the retention period is measured in.

200.description: Returned if the retention period is updated.

get.description:
Returns records from the audit log, for a time period back from the current 
date. For example, you can use this method to get the last 3 months of records.

parameters.description:
The maximum number of records to return per page. 
Note, this may be restricted by fixed system limits.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The number of units for the time period.
parameters.name: number

parameters.description:
Filters the results to records that have string property values 
matching the searchString.
parameters.name: searchString

parameters.description: The starting index of the returned records.
parameters.name: start

parameters.description: The unit of time that the time period is measured in.
parameters.name: units

200.description: Returned if the requested records are returned.

get.description: Returns all content in a Confluence instance.

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the content to expand.
By default, the following objects are expanded: space, history, version.
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description:
The maximum number of content objects to return per page. 
Note, this may be restricted by fixed system limits.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description:
Orders the content by a particular field. Specify the field and sort direction for 
this parameter, as follows: 'fieldpath asc/desc'. For example, 'history.createdDate desc'.
parameters.name: orderby

parameters.description:
The posting date of the blog post to be returned. Required for
blogpost type. Format: yyyy-mm-dd.
parameters.name: postingDay

parameters.description: The key of the space to be queried for its content.
parameters.name: spaceKey

parameters.description: The starting index of the returned content.
parameters.name: start

parameters.description:
Filter the results to a set of content based on their status. If set to any, 
content with any status is returned. Note, the historical status is currently 
not supported.
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: The title of the page to be returned. Required for page type.
parameters.name: title

parameters.description:
If set to viewed, the request will trigger a 'viewed' event for the content. 
When this event is triggered, the page/blogpost will appear on the 'Recently visited' 
tab of the user's Confluence dashboard.
parameters.name: trigger

parameters.description: The type of content to return.
parameters.name: type

200.description: Returned if the requested list of content is returned.

post.description: Creates a new piece of content or publishes an existing draft.

ancestors.description:
The parent content of the new content. Only one parent content 
id can be specified.

body.description:
The body of the new content. Does not apply to attachments. 
Only one body format should be specified as the property for 
this object, e.g. storage.

id.description: The ID of the draft content. Required when publishing a draft.

space.description: The space that the content is being created in.

status.description: The status of the new content.

type.description: The type of the new content. Custom content types defined by apps are also supported.

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the new content to expand. 
By default, the following objects are expanded: space, history, version.
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description: Filter the returned content by status.
parameters.name: status

200.description: Returned if the content is created.

delete.description:
Moves a piece of content to the space's trash or purges it from the trash, 
depending on the content's type and status:

parameters.description: The ID of the content to be deleted.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Set this to trashed, if the content's status is trashed and you want to purge it.
parameters.name: status

200.description: Returned if the content is successfully trashed.

get.description: Returns a single piece of content, like a page or a blog post.

parameters.description: The version of embedded content (e.g. attachments) to render.
parameters.name: embeddedContentRender

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the content to expand.
By default, the following objects are expanded: space, history, version.
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description:
The ID of the content to be returned. If you don't know the content ID, 
use Get content and filter the results.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description:
Filter the results to a set of content based on their status. 
If set to any, content with any status is returned. Note, the 
historical status is currently not supported.
parameters.name: status

parameters.description:
If set to viewed, the request will trigger a 'viewed' event for the content. 
When this event is triggered, the page/blogpost will appear on the 'Recently visited' 
tab of the user's Confluence dashboard.
parameters.name: trigger

parameters.description: The version number of the content to be returned.
parameters.name: version

200.description: Returned if the requested content is returned.

put.description:
Updates a piece of content. Use this method to update the title or body 
of a piece of content, change the status, change the parent page, and more.

ancestors.description: The new parent for the content. Only one parent content 'id' can be specified.

body.description:
The updated body of the content. Does not apply to attachments.
If you are not sure how to generate these formats, you can create a page in the 
Confluence application, retrieve the content using Get content, 
and expand the desired content format, e.g. expand=body.storage.

status.description:
The updated status of the content. Note, if you change the status of a page from 
'current' to 'draft' and it has an existing draft, the existing draft will be deleted 
in favour of the updated page.

title.description: The updated title of the content. If you are not changing this field, set this to the current title.

type.description: The type of content. Set this to the current type of the content.

version.description: The new version for the updated content. Set this to the current version number incremented by one, unless you are changing the status to 'draft' which must have a version number of 1.

parameters.description:
The action that should be taken when conflicts are discovered. 
Only used when publishing a draft page.
parameters.name: conflictPolicy

parameters.description: The ID of the content to be updated.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description:
The updated status of the content. Use this parameter to change the 
status of a piece of content without passing the entire request body.
parameters.name: status

200.description: Returned if the content is updated.

get.description:
Returns a map of the direct children of a piece of content. A piece of content 
has different types of child content, depending on its type. These are 
the default parent-child content type relationships:

parameters.description: A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the children to expand, where:
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description: The ID of the content to be queried for its children.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description:
The version of the parent content to retrieve children for.
Currently, this only works for the latest version.
parameters.name: parentVersion

200.description: Returned if the requested content children are returned.

get.description:
Returns all children of a given type, for a piece of content. 
A piece of content has different types of child content, depending on its type:

parameters.description: A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the new content to expand.
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description: The ID of the content to be queried for its children.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description:
The maximum number of content to return per page. Note,
this may be restricted by fixed system limits.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description:
The version of the parent content to retrieve children for.
Currently, this only works for the latest version.
parameters.name: parentVersion

parameters.description: The starting index of the returned content.
parameters.name: start

parameters.description: The type of children to return.
parameters.name: type

200.description: Returned if the requested content is returned.

get.description: Returns the attachments for a piece of content.

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the 
attachments to expand. By default, the following objects are expanded: 
metadata.
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description: Filter the results to attachments that match the filename.
parameters.name: filename

parameters.description: The ID of the content to be queried for its attachments.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description:
The maximum number of attachments to return per page. 
Note, this may be restricted by fixed system limits.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Filter the results to attachments that match the media type.
parameters.name: mediaType

parameters.description: The starting index of the returned attachments.
parameters.name: start

200.description: Returned if the requested attachments are returned.

post.description:
Adds an attachment to a piece of content. This method only adds a new 
attachment. If you want to update an existing attachment, use 
Create or update attachments.

parameters.description: The ID of the content to add the attachment to.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The status of the content that the attachment is being added to.
parameters.name: status

200.description: Returned if the attachments were added to the content.

put.description:
Adds an attachment to a piece of content. If the attachment already exists 
for the content, then the attachment is updated (i.e. a new version of the 
attachment is created).

parameters.description: The ID of the content to add the attachment to.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description:
The status of the content that the attachment is being added to. 
This should always be set to 'current'.
parameters.name: status

200.description: Returned if the attachments were added to the content.

put.description:
Updates the attachment properties, i.e. the non-binary data of an attachment 
like the filename, media-type, comment, and parent container.

parameters.description: The ID of the attachment to update.
parameters.name: attachmentId

container.description: The new content to attach the attachment to.

id.description: The ID of the attachment to be updated.

title.description: The updated name of the attachment.

version.description:
The attachment version. Set this to the current version number of the 
attachment. Note, the version number only needs to be incremented when 
updating the actual attachment, not its properties.

parameters.description: The ID of the content that the attachment is attached to.
parameters.name: id

200.description: Returned if the attachment is updated.

post.description:
Updates the binary data of an attachment, given the attachment ID, and 
optionally the comment and the minor edit field.

parameters.description: The ID of the attachment to update.
parameters.name: attachmentId

parameters.description: The ID of the content that the attachment is attached to.
parameters.name: id

200.description: Returned if the attachment is updated.

get.description: Returns the comments on a piece of content.

parameters.description:
Currently, this parameter is not used. 
Comments are returned at the root level only.
parameters.name: depth

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the 
attachments to expand.
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description: The ID of the content to be queried for its comments.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description:
The maximum number of comments to return per page. Note,
this may be restricted by fixed system limits.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description:
The location of the comments in the page. Multiple locations can be specified. 
If no location is specified, comments from all locations are returned.
parameters.name: location

parameters.description:
The version of the parent content to retrieve children for.
Currently, this only works for the latest version.
parameters.name: parentVersion

parameters.description: The starting index of the returned comments.
parameters.name: start

200.description: Returned if the requested comments are returned.

get.description:
Returns a map of the descendants of a piece of content. This is similar 
to Get content children, except that this 
method returns child pages at all levels, rather than just the direct 
child pages.

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the children to 
expand, where:
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description: The ID of the content to be queried for its descendants.
parameters.name: id

200.description: Returned if the requested descendants are returned.

get.description:
Returns all descendants of a given type, for a piece of content. This is 
similar to Get content children by type, 
except that this method returns child pages at all levels, rather than just 
the direct child pages.

parameters.description: A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the new content to expand.
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description: The ID of the content to be queried for its descendants.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description:
The maximum number of content to return per page. Note,
this may be restricted by fixed system limits.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The starting index of the returned content.
parameters.name: start

parameters.description: The type of descendants to return.
parameters.name: type

200.description: Returned if the requested content is returned.

get.description: Returns the most recent update for a piece of content.

parameters.description: A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the content history to expand.
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description: The ID of the content to be queried for its history.
parameters.name: id

200.description: Returned if the requested content history is returned.

get.description:
Returns the body of a macro in storage format, for the given macro ID. 
This includes information like the name of the macro, the body of the macro, 
and any macro parameters. This method is mainly used by Cloud apps.

parameters.description: The ID for the content that contains the macro.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description:
The ID of the macro. This is usually passed by the app that the
macro is in. Otherwise, find the macro ID by querying the desired 
content and version, then expanding the body in storage format. 
For example, '/content/196611/version/7?expand=content.body.storage'.
parameters.name: macroId

parameters.description: The version of the content that contains the macro.
parameters.name: version

200.description: Returned if the requested macro body is returned.

delete.description:
Removes a label from a piece of content. This is similar to 
Remove label from content 
except that the label name is specified via a query parameter.

parameters.description: The ID of the content that the label will be removed from.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The name of the label to be removed.
parameters.name: name

204.description: Returned if the label is removed. The response body will be empty.

get.description: Returns the labels on a piece of content.

parameters.description: The ID of the content to be queried for its labels.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description:
The maximum number of labels to return per page. Note,
this may be restricted by fixed system limits.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Filters the results to labels with the specified prefix. If this parameteris not specified, then labels with any prefix will be returned.
parameters.name: prefix

parameters.description: The starting index of the returned labels.
parameters.name: start

200.description: Returned if the requested labels are returned.

post.description: Adds labels to a piece of content. Does not modify the existing labels.

parameters.description: The ID of the content that will have labels added to it.
parameters.name: id

200.description: Returned if the labels are added to the content.

delete.description:
Removes a label from a piece of content. This is similar to 
Remove label from content using query parameter 
except that the label name is specified via a path parameter.

parameters.description: The ID of the content that the label will be removed from.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The name of the label to be removed.
parameters.name: label

204.description: Returned if the label is removed. The response body will be empty.

get.description:
Returns the watches for a page. A user that watches a page will receive 
receive notifications when the page is updated.

parameters.description: The ID of the content to be queried for its watches.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description:
The maximum number of watches to return per page. 
Note, this may be restricted by fixed system limits.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The starting index of the returned watches.
parameters.name: start

200.description: Returned if the requested watches are returned.

get.description:
Returns all space watches for the space that the content is in. A user that 
watches a space will receive receive notifications when any content in the 
space is updated.

parameters.description: The ID of the content to be queried for its watches.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description:
The maximum number of watches to return per page. 
Note, this may be restricted by fixed system limits.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The starting index of the returned watches.
parameters.name: start

200.description: Returned if the requested watches are returned.

post.description:
Copy page hierarchy allows the copying of an entire hierarchy of pages and their associated properties, permissions and attachments.
 The id path parameter refers to the content id of the page to copy, and the new parent of this copied page is defined using the destinationPageId in the request body.
 The titleOptions object defines the rules of renaming page titles during the copy;
 for example, search and replace can be used in conjunction to rewrite the copied page titles.

200.description: Returns a full JSON representation of a long running task

get.description:
Returns the properties for a piece of content. For more information 
about content properties, see Content properties in the REST API.

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the content to 
expand. By default, the version object is expanded.
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description: The ID of the content to be queried for its properties.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description:
The maximum number of properties to return per page. 
Note, this may be restricted by fixed system limits.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The starting index of the returned properties.
parameters.name: start

200.description: Returned if the requested properties are returned.

post.description:
Creates a property for an existing piece of content. For more information 
about content properties, see Content properties in the REST API.

key.description: The key of the new property.

value.description:
The value of the property. This can be empty or a complex object. 
For example,

parameters.description: The ID of the content to add the property to.
parameters.name: id

200.description: Returned if the content property is created.

delete.description:
Deletes a content property. For more information about content properties, see 
Content properties in the REST API.

parameters.description: The ID of the content that the property belongs to.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The key of the property.
parameters.name: key

204.description: Returned if the content property is deleted.

get.description:
Returns a content property for a piece of content. For more information, see 
Content properties in the REST API.

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the content to 
expand. By default, the version object is expanded.
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description: The ID of the content to be queried for the property.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The key of the content property.
parameters.name: key

200.description: Returned if the content property is returned.

post.description:
Creates a property for an existing piece of content. For more information 
about content properties, see Content properties in the REST API.

value.description:
The value of the property. This can be empty or a complex object. 
For example,

parameters.description: The ID of the content to add the property to.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The key of the content property. Required.
parameters.name: key

200.description: Returned if the content property is created.

put.description:
Updates an existing content property. This method will also create a new 
property for a piece of content, if the property key does not exist and 
the property version is 1. For more information about content properties, see 
Content properties in the REST API.

version.description: The version number of the property.

parameters.description: The ID of the content that the property belongs to.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The key of the property.
parameters.name: key

200.description: Returned if the content property is created.

delete.description: Removes all restrictions (read and update) on a piece of content.

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the content 
restrictions (returned in response) to expand.
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description: The ID of the content to remove restrictions from.
parameters.name: id

200.description: Returned if the restrictions are removed.

get.description: Returns the restrictions on a piece of content.

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the content 
restrictions to expand. By default, the following objects are expanded: 
restrictions.user, restrictions.group.
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description: The ID of the content to be queried for its restrictions.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description:
The maximum number of users and the maximum number of groups, in the 
returned restrictions, to return per page. Note, this may be restricted 
by fixed system limits.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The starting index of the users and groups in the returned restrictions.
parameters.name: start

200.description: Returned if the requested restrictions are returned.

post.description:
Adds restrictions to a piece of content. Note, this does not change any 
existing restrictions on the content.

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the content 
restrictions (returned in response) to expand.
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description: The ID of the content to add restrictions to.
parameters.name: id

200.description: Returned if the requested restrictions are added.

put.description:
Updates restrictions for a piece of content. This removes the existing 
restrictions and replaces them with the restrictions in the request.

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the content 
restrictions (returned in response) to expand.
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description: The ID of the content to update restrictions for.
parameters.name: id

200.description: Returned if the requested restrictions are updated.

get.description:
Returns restrictions on a piece of content by operation. This method is 
similar to Get restrictions except that 
the operations are properties of the return object, rather than items in 
a results array.

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the content 
restrictions to expand.
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description: The ID of the content to be queried for its restrictions.
parameters.name: id

200.description: Returned if the requested restrictions are returned.

get.description:
Returns the restictions on a piece of content for a given operation (read 
or update).

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the content 
restrictions to expand.
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description: The ID of the content to be queried for its restrictions.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description:
The maximum number of users and the maximum number of groups, in the 
returned restrictions, to return per page. Note, this may be restricted 
by fixed system limits.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The operation type of the restrictions to be returned.
parameters.name: operationKey

parameters.description: The starting index of the users and groups in the returned restrictions.
parameters.name: start

200.description: Returned if the requested restrictions are returned.

delete.description:
Removes a group from a content restriction. That is, remove read or update 
permission for the group for a piece of content.

parameters.description: The name of the group to remove from the content restriction.
parameters.name: groupName

parameters.description: The ID of the content that the restriction applies to.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The operation that the restriction applies to.
parameters.name: operationKey

200.description:
Returned if the group is removed from the content restriction. The response 
body will be empty.

get.description:
Returns whether the specified content restriction applies to a group. 
For example, if the 'admins' group has permission to read a page with an 
ID of 123, then the following request will return true:

parameters.description:
The name of the group to be queried for whether the content restriction 
applies to it.
parameters.name: groupName

parameters.description: The ID of the content that the restriction applies to.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The operation that the restriction applies to.
parameters.name: operationKey

200.description:
Returns true if the content restriction applies to the group. The response 
will not return a response body.

put.description:
Adds a group to a content restriction. That is, grant read or update 
permission to the group for a piece of content.

parameters.description: The name of the group to add to the content restriction.
parameters.name: groupName

parameters.description: The ID of the content that the restriction applies to.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The operation that the restriction applies to.
parameters.name: operationKey

200.description:
Returned if the group is added to the content restriction. The response 
body will be empty.

delete.description:
Removes a group from a content restriction. That is, remove read or update 
permission for the group for a piece of content.

parameters.description: The account ID of the user to remove from the content restriction.
parameters.name: accountId

parameters.description: The ID of the content that the restriction applies to.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The key of the user to remove from the content restriction.
parameters.name: key

parameters.description: The operation that the restriction applies to.
parameters.name: operationKey

parameters.description: The username of the user to remove from the content restriction.
parameters.name: userName

200.description:
Returned if the user is removed from the content restriction. The response 
body will be empty.

get.description:
Returns whether the specified content restriction applies to a user. 
For example, if the user 'admin' has permission to read a page with an 
ID of 123, then the following request will return true:

parameters.description:
The account ID of the user to be queried for whether the content 
restriction applies to it.
parameters.name: accountId

parameters.description: The ID of the content that the restriction applies to.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description:
The key of the user to be queried for whether the content 
restriction applies to it.
parameters.name: key

parameters.description: The operation that is restricted.
parameters.name: operationKey

parameters.description:
The username of the user to be queried for whether the content 
restriction applies to it.
parameters.name: userName

200.description:
Return true if the content restriction applies to the user. The response 
body will be empty.

put.description:
Adds a user to a content restriction. That is, grant read or update 
permission to the user for a piece of content.

parameters.description: The account ID of the user to add to the content restriction.
parameters.name: accountId

parameters.description: The ID of the content that the restriction applies to.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The key of the user to add to the content restriction.
parameters.name: key

parameters.description: The operation that the restriction applies to.
parameters.name: operationKey

parameters.description: The username of the user to add to the content restriction.
parameters.name: userName

200.description:
Returned if the user is added to the content restriction. The response 
body will be empty.

get.description: Returns the versions for a piece of content in descending order.

parameters.description: A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the content to expand.
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description: The ID of the content to be queried for its versions.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description:
The maximum number of versions to return per page. 
Note, this may be restricted by fixed system limits.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The starting index of the returned versions.
parameters.name: start

200.description: Returned if the requested versions are returned.

post.description:
Restores a historical version to be the latest version. That is, a new version 
is created with the content of the historical version.

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the returned
content to expand.
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description: The ID of the content for which the history will be restored.
parameters.name: id

200.description: Returned if the version is restored.

delete.description:
Delete a historical version. This does not delete the changes made to the 
content in that version, rather the changes for the deleted version are 
rolled up into the next version. Note, you cannot delete the current version.

parameters.description: The ID of the content that the version will be deleted from.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description:
The number of the version to be deleted. The version number starts 
from 1 up to current version.
parameters.name: versionNumber

204.description: Returned if the version is deleted.

get.description: Returns a version for a piece of content.

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the content to 
expand. By default, the content object is expanded.
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description: The ID of the content to be queried for its version.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The number of the version to be retrieved.
parameters.name: versionNumber

200.description: Returned if the version is returned.

post.description:
Publishes a legacy draft of a page created from a blueprint. Legacy drafts 
will eventually be removed in favour of shared drafts. For now, this method 
works the same as Publish shared draft.

ancestors.description:
The new ancestor (i.e. parent page) for the content. If you have 
specified an ancestor, you must also specify a space property 
in the request body for the space that the ancestor is in.

status.description: The status of the content. Set this to current or omit it altogether.

title.description:
The title of the content. If you don't want to change the title, 
set this to the current title of the draft.

type.description: The type of content. Set this to page.

version.description: The version for the new content.

parameters.description:
The ID of the draft page that was created from a blueprint. 
You can find the draftId in the Confluence application by 
opening the draft page and checking the page URL.
parameters.name: draftId

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the new content 
to expand when returned. By default, the following objects are expanded: 
body.storage,history,space,version,ancestors
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description:
The status of the content to be updated, i.e. the draft. This is set 
to 'draft' by default, so you shouldn't need to specify it.
parameters.name: status

200.description: Returned if the draft was successfully published.

put.description: Publishes a shared draft of a page created from a blueprint.

ancestors.description:
The new ancestor (i.e. parent page) for the content. If you have 
specified an ancestor, you must also specify a space property 
in the request body for the space that the ancestor is in.

status.description: The status of the content. Set this to current or omit it altogether.

title.description:
The title of the content. If you don't want to change the title, 
set this to the current title of the draft.

type.description: The type of content. Set this to page.

version.description: The version for the new content.

parameters.description:
The ID of the draft page that was created from a blueprint. 
You can find the draftId in the Confluence application by 
opening the draft page and checking the page URL.
parameters.name: draftId

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the new content 
to expand when returned. By default, the following objects are expanded: 
body.storage,history,space,version,ancestors
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description:
The status of the content to be updated, i.e. the draft. This is set 
to 'draft' by default, so you shouldn't need to specify it.
parameters.name: status

200.description: Returned if the draft was successfully published.

get.description:
Returns the list of content that matches a Confluence Query Language 
(CQL) query. For information on CQL, see: 
Advanced searching using CQL.

parameters.description: The CQL string that is used to find the requested content.
parameters.name: cql

parameters.description:
The space, content, and content status to execute the search against. 
Specify this as an object with the following properties:
parameters.name: cqlcontext

parameters.description: A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the content to expand.
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description:
The maximum number of content objects to return per page. 
Note, this may be restricted by fixed system limits.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The starting index of the returned content.
parameters.name: start

200.description: Returned if the requested list of content is returned.

post.description: Converts a content body from one format to another format.

representation.description:
The content format type. Set the value of this property to 
the name of the format being used, e.g. 'storage'.

value.description: The body of the content in the relevant format.

parameters.description:
The content ID used to find the space for resolving embedded content 
(page includes, files, and links) in the content body. For example, 
if the source content contains the link <ac:link><ri:page ri:content-title="Example page" /><ac:link> 
and the contentIdContext=123 parameter is provided, then the link 
will be converted to a link to the "Example page" page in the same space 
that has the content with ID=123. Note, spaceKeyContext will be ignored 
if this parameter is provided.
parameters.name: contentIdContext

parameters.description: Mode used for rendering embedded content, like attachments.
parameters.name: embeddedContentRender

parameters.description: A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the new content to expand.
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description:
The space key used for resolving embedded content (page includes, 
files, and links) in the content body. For example, if the source content 
contains the link <ac:link><ri:page ri:content-title="Example page" /><ac:link> 
and the spaceKeyContext=TEST parameter is provided, then the link 
will be converted to a link to the "Example page" page in the "TEST" space.
parameters.name: spaceKeyContext

parameters.description: The name of the target format for the content body.
parameters.name: to

200.description: Returned if the content is converted.

get.description:
Returns all user groups. The returned groups are ordered alphabetically in
ascending order by group name.

parameters.description:
The maximum number of groups to return per page. 
Note, this may be restricted by fixed system limits.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The starting index of the returned groups.
parameters.name: start

200.description: Returned if the requested groups are returned.

get.description: Returns a user group for a given group name.

parameters.description:
The name of the group. This is the same as the group name shown in 
the Confluence administration console.
parameters.name: groupName

200.description: Returned if the requested group is returned.

get.description: Returns the users that are members of a group.

parameters.description: The name of the group to be queried for its members.
parameters.name: groupName

parameters.description:
The maximum number of users to return per page. 
Note, this may be restricted by fixed system limits.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The starting index of the returned users.
parameters.name: start

200.description: Returned if the requested users are returned.

get.description:
Returns information about all active long-running tasks (e.g. space export), 
such as how long each task has been running and the percentage of each task 
that has completed.

parameters.description:
The maximum number of tasks to return per page. Note, this may be
restricted by fixed system limits.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The starting index of the returned tasks.
parameters.name: start

200.description: Returned if the requested tasks are returned.

get.description:
Returns information about an active long-running task (e.g. space export), 
such as how long it has been running and the percentage of the task that 
has completed.

parameters.description: The ID of the task.
parameters.name: id

200.description: Returned if the requested task is returned.

get.description:
Returns all target entities that have a particular relationship to the 
source entity. Note, relationships are one way.

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the response 
object to expand.
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description:
The maximum number of relationships to return per page. 
Note, this may be restricted by fixed system limits.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description:
The name of the relationship. This method supports relationships created via 
Create relationship. 
Note, this method does not support 'favourite' relationships.
parameters.name: relationName

parameters.description: The identifier for the source entity:
parameters.name: sourceKey

parameters.description:
The status of the source. This parameter is only used when the
sourceType is 'content'.
parameters.name: sourceStatus

parameters.description: The source entity type of the relationship.
parameters.name: sourceType

parameters.description:
The version of the source. This parameter is only used when the
sourceType is 'content' and the sourceStatus is 'historical'.
parameters.name: sourceVersion

parameters.description: The starting index of the returned relationships.
parameters.name: start

parameters.description:
The status of the target. This parameter is only used when the
targetType is 'content'.
parameters.name: targetStatus

parameters.description: The target entity type of the relationship.
parameters.name: targetType

parameters.description:
The version of the target. This parameter is only used when the
targetType is 'content' and the targetStatus is 'historical'.
parameters.name: targetVersion

200.description: Returned if the requested relationships are returned.

delete.description: Deletes a relationship between two entities (user, space, content).

parameters.description: The name of the relationship.
parameters.name: relationName

parameters.description: The identifier for the source entity:
parameters.name: sourceKey

parameters.description:
The status of the source. This parameter is only used when the
sourceType is 'content'.
parameters.name: sourceStatus

parameters.description:
The source entity type of the relationship. This must be 'user', if 
the relationName is 'favourite'.
parameters.name: sourceType

parameters.description:
The version of the source. This parameter is only used when the
sourceType is 'content' and the sourceStatus is 'historical'.
parameters.name: sourceVersion

parameters.description: The identifier for the target entity:
parameters.name: targetKey

parameters.description:
The status of the target. This parameter is only used when the
targetType is 'content'.
parameters.name: targetStatus

parameters.description:
The target entity type of the relationship. This must be 'space' or 
'content', if the relationName is 'favourite'.
parameters.name: targetType

parameters.description:
The version of the target. This parameter is only used when the
targetType is 'content' and the targetStatus is 'historical'.
parameters.name: targetVersion

204.description:
Returned if the relationship is deleted or the relationship didn't
exist.

get.description:
Find whether a particular type of relationship exists from a source 
entity to a target entity. Note, relationships are one way.

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the response 
object to expand.
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description:
The name of the relationship. This method supports the 'favourite' 
(i.e. 'save for later') relationship as well as any other relationship 
types created via Create relationship.
parameters.name: relationName

parameters.description: The identifier for the source entity:
parameters.name: sourceKey

parameters.description:
The status of the source. This parameter is only used when the
sourceType is 'content'.
parameters.name: sourceStatus

parameters.description:
The source entity type of the relationship. This must be 'user', if 
the relationName is 'favourite'.
parameters.name: sourceType

parameters.description:
The version of the source. This parameter is only used when the
sourceType is 'content' and the sourceStatus is 'historical'.
parameters.name: sourceVersion

parameters.description: The identifier for the target entity:
parameters.name: targetKey

parameters.description:
The status of the target. This parameter is only used when the
targetType is 'content'.
parameters.name: targetStatus

parameters.description:
The target entity type of the relationship. This must be 'space' or 
'content', if the relationName is 'favourite'.
parameters.name: targetType

parameters.description:
The version of the target. This parameter is only used when the
targetType is 'content' and the targetStatus is 'historical'.
parameters.name: targetVersion

200.description: Returned if the relationship exists.

put.description:
Creates a relationship between two entities (user, space, content). The 
'favourite' relationship is supported by default, but you can use this method 
to create any type of relationship between two entities.

parameters.description:
The name of the relationship. This method supports the 'favourite' 
(i.e. 'save for later') relationship. You can also specify any other 
value for this parameter to create a custom relationship type.
parameters.name: relationName

parameters.description: The identifier for the source entity:
parameters.name: sourceKey

parameters.description:
The status of the source. This parameter is only used when the
sourceType is 'content'.
parameters.name: sourceStatus

parameters.description:
The source entity type of the relationship. This must be 'user', if 
the relationName is 'favourite'.
parameters.name: sourceType

parameters.description:
The version of the source. This parameter is only used when the
sourceType is 'content' and the sourceStatus is 'historical'.
parameters.name: sourceVersion

parameters.description: The identifier for the target entity:
parameters.name: targetKey

parameters.description:
The status of the target. This parameter is only used when the
targetType is 'content'.
parameters.name: targetStatus

parameters.description:
The target entity type of the relationship. This must be 'space' or 
'content', if the relationName is 'favourite'.
parameters.name: targetType

parameters.description:
The version of the target. This parameter is only used when the
targetType is 'content' and the targetStatus is 'historical'.
parameters.name: targetVersion

200.description: Returned if the relationship is created.

get.description:
Returns all target entities that have a particular relationship to the 
source entity. Note, relationships are one way.

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the response 
object to expand.
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description:
The maximum number of relationships to return per page. 
Note, this may be restricted by fixed system limits.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description:
The name of the relationship. This method supports relationships created via 
Create relationship. 
Note, this method does not support 'favourite' relationships.
parameters.name: relationName

parameters.description:
The status of the source. This parameter is only used when the
sourceType is 'content'.
parameters.name: sourceStatus

parameters.description: The source entity type of the relationship.
parameters.name: sourceType

parameters.description:
The version of the source. This parameter is only used when the
sourceType is 'content' and the sourceStatus is 'historical'.
parameters.name: sourceVersion

parameters.description: The starting index of the returned relationships.
parameters.name: start

parameters.description: The identifier for the target entity:
parameters.name: targetKey

parameters.description:
The status of the target. This parameter is only used when the
targetType is 'content'.
parameters.name: targetStatus

parameters.description: The target entity type of the relationship.
parameters.name: targetType

parameters.description:
The version of the target. This parameter is only used when the
targetType is 'content' and the targetStatus is 'historical'.
parameters.name: targetVersion

200.description: Returned if the requested relationships are returned.

get.description:
Searches for content using the 
Confluence Query Language (CQL)

parameters.description:
The CQL query to be used for the search. See 
Advanced Searching using CQL 
for instructions on how to build a CQL query.
parameters.name: cql

parameters.description:
The space, content, and content status to execute the search
against.
parameters.name: cqlcontext

parameters.description: Include content from archived spaces in the results.
parameters.name: includeArchivedSpaces

parameters.description:
The maximum number of content objects to return per page. 
Note, this may be restricted by fixed system limits.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The starting index of the returned content.
parameters.name: start

200.description: Returned if the requested results are returned.

get.description:
Returns the look and feel settings for the site or a single space. This 
includes attributes such as the color scheme, padding, and border radius.

parameters.description:
The key of the space for which the look and feel settings will be
returned. If this is not set, only the global look and feel settings
are returned.
parameters.name: spaceKey

200.description: Returned if the requested look and feel settings are returned.

delete.description:
Resets the custom look and feel settings for the site or a single space.
This changes the values of the custom settings to be the same as the 
default settings. It does not change which settings (default or custom) 
are selected. Note, the default space settings are inherited from the 
current global settings.

parameters.description:
The key of the space for which the look and feel settings will be
reset. If this is not set, the global look and feel settings will 
be reset.
parameters.name: spaceKey

204.description: Returned if the look and feel settings have been reset.

post.description:
Updates the look and feel settings for the site or for a single space.
If custom settings exist, they are updated. If no custom settings exist, 
then a set of custom settings is created.

parameters.description:
The key of the space for which the look and feel settings will be
updated. If this is not set, the global look and feel settings will 
be updated.
parameters.name: spaceKey

200.description: Returned if the look and feel settings are updated.

put.description:
Sets the look and feel settings to either the default settings or the
custom settings, for the site or a single space. Note, the default 
space settings are inherited from the current global settings.

selected.description:
The look and feel scheme. If you set this to global, you must specify 
the current global look and feel settings as a global object in this 
request. Similarly, if you set this to custom, you must specify the 
current custom look and feel settings as a custom object in this request.

parameters.description:
The key of the space for which the look and feel settings will be
set. If this is not set, the global look and feel settings will be 
set.
parameters.name: spaceKey

200.description: Returned if the look and feel settings were set.

get.description:
Returns the system information for the Confluence Cloud tenant. This
information is used by Atlassian.

200.description:
Returned if the system information for the Confluence Cloud tenant
is returned.

get.description: Returns all themes, not including the default theme.

parameters.description:
The maximum number of themes to return per page. 
Note, this may be restricted by fixed system limits.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The starting index of the returned themes.
parameters.name: start

200.description: Returned if the requested themes are returned.

get.description:
Returns a theme. This includes information about the theme name,
description, and icon.

parameters.description: The key of the theme to be returned.
parameters.name: themeKey

200.description: Returned if the requested theme is returned.

get.description: Returns the globally assigned theme.

200.description: Returned if the global theme is returned.

get.description:
Returns all spaces. The returned spaces are ordered alphabetically in
ascending order by space key.

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the spaces to
expand, where:
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description:
Filter the results to the favourite spaces of the user specified by
favouriteUserKey. Note, 'favourite' spaces are also
known as 'saved for later' spaces.
parameters.name: favourite

parameters.description:
The userKey of the user, whose favourite spaces are used to filter
the results when using the favourite parameter.
parameters.name: favouriteUserKey

parameters.description: Filter the results to spaces based on their label.
parameters.name: label

parameters.description:
The maximum number of spaces to return per page. Note, this may be
restricted by fixed system limits.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description:
The key of the space to be returned. To return multiple spaces,
specify this parameter multiple times with different values.
parameters.name: spaceKey

parameters.description: The starting index of the returned spaces.
parameters.name: start

parameters.description: Filter the results to spaces based on their status.
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: Filter the results to spaces based on their type.
parameters.name: type

200.description: Returned if the requested spaces are returned.

post.description:
Creates a new space. Note, currently you cannot set space labels when
creating a space.

description.description:
The description of the new/updated space. Note, only the 'plain' representation 
can be used for the description when creating or updating a space.

key.description:
The key for the new space. Format: See Space
keys.

name.description: The name of the new space.

permissions.description:
The permissions for the new space. If no permissions are provided, the 
Confluence default space permissions
are applied. Note, for security reasons, permissions cannot be changed
via the API after the space has been created, and must be changed via
the user interface instead.

200.description: Returned if the space is created.

post.description:
Creates a new space that is only visible to the creator. This method is
the same as the Create space method with permissions
set to the current user only. Note, currently you cannot set space
labels when creating a space.

description.description:
The description of the new/updated space. Note, only the 'plain' representation 
can be used for the description when creating or updating a space.

key.description:
The key for the new space. Format: See Space
keys.

name.description: The name of the new space.

200.description: Returned if the space is created.

delete.description:
Deletes a space. Note, the space will be deleted in a long running task.
Therefore, the space may not be deleted yet when this method has
returned. Clients should poll the status link that is returned in the
response until the task completes.

parameters.description: The key of the space to delete.
parameters.name: spaceKey

202.description: Returns a pointer to the status of the space deletion task.

get.description:
Returns a space. This includes information like the name, description,
and permissions, but not the content in the space.

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the space to
expand, where:
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description: The key of the space to be returned.
parameters.name: spaceKey

200.description: Returned if the requested space is returned.

put.description: Updates the name, description, or homepage of a space.

description.description:
The description of the new/updated space. Note, only the 'plain' representation 
can be used for the description when creating or updating a space.

homepage.description: The page to set as the homepage of the space.

parameters.description: The key of the space to update.
parameters.name: spaceKey

200.description: Returned if the space is updated.

get.description:
Returns all content in a space. The returned content is grouped by type
(pages then blogposts), then ordered by content ID in ascending order.

parameters.description: Filter the results to content at the root level of the space or all content.
parameters.name: depth

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the content
to expand, where:
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description:
The maximum number of content objects to return per page. Note, this 
may be restricted by fixed system limits.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The key of the space to be queried for its content.
parameters.name: spaceKey

parameters.description: The starting index of the returned content.
parameters.name: start

200.description: Returned if the requested content is returned.

get.description:
Returns all content of a given type, in a space. The returned content is
ordered by content ID in ascending order.

parameters.description:
Filter the results to content at the root level of the space or all
content.
parameters.name: depth

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the content
to expand, where:
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description:
The maximum number of content objects to return per page. Note, this 
may be restricted by fixed system limits.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The key of the space to be queried for its content.
parameters.name: spaceKey

parameters.description: The starting index of the returned content.
parameters.name: start

parameters.description: The type of content to return.
parameters.name: type

200.description: Returned if the requested content is returned.

get.description: Returns all properties for the given space. Space properties are a key-value storage associated with a space.

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the space
property to expand. By default, the version object is expanded.
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description:
The maximum number of properties to return per page. Note, this may be
restricted by fixed system limits.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The key of the space to be queried for its properties.
parameters.name: spaceKey

parameters.description: The starting index of the returned objects.
parameters.name: start

200.description: Returned if the requested space properties are returned.

post.description: Creates a new space property.

key.description: The key of the new property.

value.description:
The value of the property. This can be empty or a complex object. 
For example,

parameters.description: The key of the space that the property will be created in.
parameters.name: spaceKey

200.description: Returned if the space property is created.

parameters.description: The key of the property to be deleted.
parameters.name: key

parameters.description: The key of the space that the property is in.
parameters.name: spaceKey

204.description: Returned if the space property is deleted.

get.description: Returns a space property.

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the space
property to expand. By default, the version object is expanded.
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description: The key of the space property.
parameters.name: key

parameters.description: The key of the space that the property is in.
parameters.name: spaceKey

200.description: Returned if the requested space property is returned.

post.description:
Creates a new space property. This is the same as POST
/space/{spaceKey}/property but the key for the property is passed as a
path parameter, rather than in the request body.

value.description:
The value of the property. This can be empty or a complex object. 
For example,

parameters.description: The key of the property to be created.
parameters.name: key

parameters.description: The key of the space that the property will be created in.
parameters.name: spaceKey

200.description: Returned if the space property is created.

put.description:
Updates a space property. Note, you cannot update the key of a space
property, only the value.

version.description: The version number of the property.

parameters.description: The key of the property to be updated.
parameters.name: key

parameters.description: The key of the space that the property is in.
parameters.name: spaceKey

200.description: Returned if the space property is updated.

get.description:
Returns the settings of a space. Currently only the
routeOverrideEnabled setting can be returned.

parameters.description: The key of the space to be queried for its settings.
parameters.name: spaceKey

200.description: Returned if the space settings are returned.

put.description:
Updates the settings for a space. Currently only the
routeOverrideEnabled setting can be updated.

routeOverrideEnabled.description:
Defines whether an override for the space home should be used. This is
used in conjunction with a space theme provided by an app. For
example, if this property is set to true, a theme can display a page
other than the space homepage when users visit the root URL for a
space. This property allows apps to provide content-only theming
without overriding the space home.

parameters.description: The key of the space whose settings will be updated.
parameters.name: spaceKey

200.description: Returned if space settings are updated.

delete.description:
Resets the space theme. This means that the space will inherit the 
global look and feel settings

parameters.description: The key of the space to reset the theme for.
parameters.name: spaceKey

204.description: Returned if the theme was reset for the space.

get.description:
Returns the theme selected for a space, if one is set. If no space 
theme is set, this means that the space is inheriting the global look 
and feel settings.

parameters.description: The key of the space to be queried for its theme.
parameters.name: spaceKey

200.description: Returned if the requested theme is returned.

put.description:
Sets the theme for a space. Note, if you want to reset the space theme to 
the default Confluence theme, use the 'Reset space theme' method instead 
of this method.

themeKey.description: The key of the theme to be set as the space theme.

parameters.description: The key of the space to set the theme for.
parameters.name: spaceKey

200.description: Returned if the theme was set for the space.

post.description: Creates a new content template. Note, blueprint templates cannot be created via the REST API.

body.description: This object is used when creating or updating content.

description.description: A description of the new template.

name.description: The name of the new template.

space.description:
The key for the space of the new template. Only applies to space templates. 
If the spaceKey is not specified, the template will be created as a global 
template.

templateType.description: The type of the new template. Set to page.

200.description: Returned if the template is created.

put.description:
Updates a content template. Note, blueprint templates cannot be updated
via the REST API.

body.description: This object is used when creating or updating content.

name.description:
The name of the template. Set to the current name if this field is 
not being updated.

space.description:
The key for the space of the template. Required if the template is a 
space template. Set this to the current space.key.

templateId.description: The ID of the template being updated.

templateType.description: The type of the template. Set to page.

200.description: Returned if the template is updated.

delete.description:
Deletes a template. This results in different actions depending on the 
type of template:

parameters.description: The ID of the template to be deleted.
parameters.name: contentTemplateId

204.description: Returned if the template has been successfully been deleted.

get.description:
Returns a content template. This includes information about template, 
like the name, the space or blueprint that the template is in, the body 
of the template, and more.

parameters.description: The ID of the content template to be returned.
parameters.name: contentTemplateId

200.description: Returned if the requested template is returned.

get.description:
Returns all templates provided by blueprints. Use this method to retrieve 
all global blueprint templates or all blueprint templates in a space.

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the template
to expand.
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description:
The maximum number of templates to return per page. 
Note, this may be restricted by fixed system limits.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description:
The key of the space to be queried for templates. If the spaceKey 
is not specified, global blueprint templates will be returned.
parameters.name: spaceKey

parameters.description: The starting index of the returned templates.
parameters.name: start

200.description: Returned if the requested templates are returned.

get.description:
Returns all content templates. Use this method to retrieve all global
content templates or all content templates in a space.

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the template
to expand.
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description:
The maximum number of templates to return per page. 
Note, this may be restricted by fixed system limits.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description:
The key of the space to be queried for templates. If the spaceKey 
is not specified, global templates will be returned.
parameters.name: spaceKey

parameters.description: The starting index of the returned templates.
parameters.name: start

200.description: Returned if the requested templates are returned.

get.description:
Returns a user. This includes information about the user, like the
display name, userKey, account ID, profile picture, and more.

parameters.description:
The accountId of the user to be returned. Required, unless the 
username or key is specified. The accountId uniquely identifies 
a user across all Atlassian products.
parameters.name: accountId

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the user to
expand.
parameters.name: expand

parameters.description:
The userKey of the user to be returned. Required, unless the 
username or accountId is specified. The key uniquely identifies 
a user in a Confluence instance and does not change.
parameters.name: key

parameters.description:
The username of the user to be returned. Required, unless the key 
or accountId is specified. The username uniquely identifies a 
user in a Confluence instance but can change if the user is renamed.
parameters.name: username

200.description: Returned if the requested user is returned.

get.description:
Returns information about how anonymous users are represented, like the
profile picture and display name.

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the user to
expand.
parameters.name: expand

200.description: Returned if the anonymous user representation is returned.

get.description:
Returns the currently logged-in user. This includes information about
the user, like the display name, userKey, account ID, profile picture,
and more.

parameters.description:
A multi-value parameter indicating which properties of the user to
expand.
parameters.name: expand

200.description: Returned if the current user is returned.

get.description: Returns the groups that a user is a member of.

parameters.description:
The accountId of the user to be queried. Required, unless the 
username or key is specified. The accountId uniquely identifies 
a user across all Atlassian products.
parameters.name: accountId

parameters.description:
The userKey of the user to be queried. Required, unless the 
username or accountId is specified. The key uniquely identifies 
a user in a Confluence instance and does not change.
parameters.name: key

parameters.description:
The maximum number of groups to return per page. 
Note, this may be restricted by fixed system limits.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The starting index of the returned groups.
parameters.name: start

parameters.description:
The username of the user to be queried. Required, unless the key 
or accountId is specified. The username uniquely identifies a 
user in a Confluence instance but can change if the user is renamed.
parameters.name: username

200.description: Returned if the requested groups are returned.

delete.description:
Removes a user as a watcher from a piece of content. Choose the user by 
doing one of the following:

parameters.description:
The accountId of the user that will be removed as a watcher. Only one of 
username, key, accountId can be used to identify the user in 
the request.
parameters.name: accountId

parameters.description: The ID of the content to remove the watcher from.
parameters.name: contentId

parameters.description:
The key of the user that will be removed as a watcher. Only one of 
username, key, accountId can be used to identify the user in 
the request.
parameters.name: key

parameters.description:
The username of the user that will be removed as a watcher. Only one of 
username, key, accountId can be used to identify the user in 
the request.
parameters.name: username

204.description:
Returned if the watcher was successfully deleted. No response body is 
returned.

get.description:
Returns whether a user is watching a piece of content. Choose the user by 
doing one of the following:

parameters.description:
The accountId of the user to be queried for whether they are watching 
the content. Only one of username, key, accountId can be used to 
identify the user in the request.
parameters.name: accountId

parameters.description:
The ID of the content to be queried for whether the specified user is 
watching it.
parameters.name: contentId

parameters.description:
The key of the user to be queried for whether they are watching the 
content. Only one of username, key, accountId can be used to 
identify the user in the request.
parameters.name: key

parameters.description:
The username of the user to be queried for whether they are watching 
the content. Only one of username, key, accountId can be used to 
identify the user in the request.
parameters.name: username

200.description: Returned if the requested watch status is returned.

post.description:
Adds a user as a watcher to a piece of content. Choose the user by doing 
one of the following:

parameters.description:
The accountId of the user that will be added as a watcher. Only one 
of username, key, accountId can be used to identify the user in 
the request.
parameters.name: accountId

parameters.description: The ID of the content to add the watcher to.
parameters.name: contentId

parameters.description:
The key of the user that will be added as a watcher. Only one of 
username, key, accountId can be used to identify the user in 
the request.
parameters.name: key

parameters.description:
The username of the user that will be added as a watcher. Only one 
of username, key, accountId can be used to identify the user in 
the request.
parameters.name: username

204.description:
Returned if the watcher was successfully created. No response body is 
returned.

delete.description:
Removes a user as a watcher from a label. Choose the user by doing one of 
the following:

parameters.description:
The accountId of the user that will be removed as a watcher. Only one of

the request.
parameters.name: accountId

parameters.description:
The key of the user that will be removed as a watcher. Only one of 
username, key, accountId can be used to identify the user in 
the request.
parameters.name: key

parameters.description: The name of the label to remove the watcher from.
parameters.name: labelName

parameters.description:
The username of the user that will be removed as a watcher. Only one of 
username, key, accountId can be used to identify the user in 
the request.
parameters.name: username

204.description:
Returned if the watcher was successfully deleted. No response body is 
returned.
